sense.gloss: chopsticks
dispensable chopsticks, throwaway chopsticks
long metal chopsticks (for handling charcoal, esp. in a brazier), fire tongs
entremets, intermezzo, small palate-cleansing dish served between courses
chopstick rest
chopstick case
lacquered chopsticks
long chopsticks (for cooking, serving, etc.)
chopsticks made of cedar
spoon and chopsticks
type of long chopsticks used in the preparation of fish, type of long chopsticks used to hold the fish in carving knife ceremony
burning-hot tongs, red-hot tongs
chopstick usage

k_ele.e: 箸にも棒にもかからない
箸にも棒にも掛からない

r_ele.r: はしにもぼうにもかからない

sense.gloss: hopeless, incorrigible, beyond repair, good-for-nothing, terrible
weaning ceremony
chopstick envelope, chopstick wrapper, paper envelope in which chopsticks are presented
using one's chopsticks to jump from side dish to side dish without pausing to eat rice in between (a breach of etiquette)
using one's chopsticks to find a food one likes by rummaging in one's dish, pot, etc. (a breach of etiquette)
poking one's food around using one's chopsticks, playing with one's food with one's chopsticks (a breach of etiquette)
chopsticks used to move food from a serving dish to one's own dish
grasping one's chopsticks the same way one might hold a walking stick (a breach of etiquette)
hovering one's chopsticks back and forth over side dishes, when trying to choose which one to take (a breach of etiquette)
hovering one's chopsticks back and forth over side dishes, when trying to choose which one to take (a breach of etiquette)
skewering one's food with a chopstick in order to pick it up (a breach of etiquette)
touching a food with one's chopsticks, then removing them without taking it (a breach of etiquette)
dripping liquid (soup, sauce, etc.) from the tips of one's chopsticks (a breach of etiquette)
ringing one's chopsticks against a dish (in order to request seconds, etc.) (a breach of etiquette)
drawing a dish towards oneself using one's chopsticks (a breach of etiquette)
holding one's chopsticks in one's mouth (a breach of etiquette)
resting one's chopsticks across the top of one's bowl (a breach of etiquette)

sdata.j: ルーシーは↑箸↑↓はし↓が↑使↑↓つか↓えないんだ。
sdata.e: Lucy cannot use chopsticks.

sdata.j: パーカーさんは↑箸↑↓はし↓で↑食↑↓た↓べてみました。
sdata.e: Mr Parker tried eating with chopsticks.

sdata.j: トレーシーはそのときまでお↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ったことが↑無↑↓な↓かった。
sdata.e: Tracy had never used chopsticks before then.

sdata.j: トレーシーはその↑時↑↓とき↓まで↑一↑↓いち↓↑度↑↓ど↓も↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓ったことがなかった。
sdata.e: Tracy had never used chopsticks before then.

sdata.j: その↑少年↑↓しょうねん↓は↑箸↑↓はし↓で↑食↑↓た↓べてみた。
sdata.e: The boy tried eating with chopsticks.

sdata.j: ↑最↑↓もっと↓も↑古↑↓ふる↓い↑中国↑↓ちゅうごく↓の↑箸↑↓はし↓の↑中↑↓なか↓には、↑紀元前↑↓きげんぜん↓1200↑年↑↓ねん↓にもさかのぼるものもある。
sdata.e: Some of the oldest Chinese chopsticks date from 1200 B.C.

sdata.j: ↑使↑↓つか↓い↑捨↑↓す↓ての↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓うよりもプラスチックの↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑洗↑↓あら↓って↑使↑↓つか↓う↑方↑↓ほう↓がいい。
sdata.e: It's better to carry plastic chopsticks and wash them than to use disposable chopsticks to throw away.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓たちはナイフとフォークの↑代↑↓か↓わりに↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓う。
sdata.e: We use chopsticks in place of knives and forks.

sdata.j: ↑箸↑↓はし↓の↑使↑↓つか↓い↑方↑↓かた↓にはもうすっかりお↑慣↑↓な↓れになったでしょう。
sdata.e: You must be quite accustomed to using chopsticks by now.

sdata.j: ↑和食↑↓わしょく↓のレストランへ↑行↑↓い↓くたびに、↑割↑↓わ↓り↑箸↑↓ばし↓を↑家↑↓いえ↓へもって↑帰↑↓かえ↓ります。
sdata.e: Whenever I go to a Japanese restaurant, I take the disposable chopsticks home with me.

sdata.j: でも、お↑箸↑↓はし↓、↑一↑↓いち↓↑膳↑↓ぜん↓しかないの。どうしよう・・・。
sdata.e: But there's only one pair of chopsticks. What shall we do?

sdata.j: ↑箸↑↓はし↓で↑日本↑↓にほん↓↑料理↑↓りょうり↓を↑食↑↓た↓べるのがあまり↑上手↑↓じょうず↓じゃないのに。
sdata.e: I'm not good at eating Japanese food with chopsticks.

sdata.j: ↑使↑↓つか↓い↑捨↑↓す↓ての↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓うよりもプラスチックの↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑洗↑↓あら↓って↑使↑↓つか↓う↑方↑↓ほう↓がいい。
sdata.e: Instead of using disposable chopsticks, it's better to use plastic chopsticks that you can wash.

sdata.j: ↑使↑↓つか↓い↑捨↑↓す↓ての↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑使↑↓つか↓うよりもプラスチックの↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑洗↑↓あら↓って↑使↑↓つか↓う↑方↑↓ほう↓がいい。
sdata.e: It's better to use plastic chopsticks and wash them than to use disposable chopsticks.

sdata.j: ルーシーは↑箸↑↓はし↓が↑使↑↓つか↓えないんだ。
sdata.e: Lucy can't use chopsticks.

sdata.j: パーカーさんは↑箸↑↓はし↓で↑食↑↓た↓べてみました。

sdata.j: すみません、お↑箸↑↓はし↓を↑落↑↓お↓としてしまったんですが。
sdata.e: Excuse me, I dropped a chopstick.
